snippet: Judy A. Mikovits, whose later-discredited paper linking chronic fatigue syndrome to a little-known retrovirus drew wide notice, had been accused of theft by her former employer.
abstract: Nevada authorities drop criminal charges against Judy A Mikovits, researcher who gained wide attention for scientific reports linking chronic fatigue syndrome to an obscure mouse retrovirus; Mikovits had been charged with stealing proprietary laboratory materials from her former employer, the Whittemore Peterson Institute for Neuro-Immune Disease in Reno, Nev.
lead_paragraph: Judy A. Mikovits, whose later-discredited paper linking chronic fatigue syndrome to a little-known retrovirus drew wide notice, had been accused of theft by her former employer.

headline.seo: Chronic Fatigue Researcher Won’t Face Theft Charges
headline.main: No Theft Charge for Chronic Fatigue Researcher

keywords.value: Whittemore Peterson Institute for Neuro-Immune Disease
keywords.name: organizations
